catalog_info.title: Crime and Punishment in the United States , 1800-2000
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: This course will examine the history of crime and punishment in the United States from the nineteenth through the twentieth century. We will examine early ideas about crime and punishment, and how they changed over the past two centuries. Topics will include the rise of the penitentiary, the rise and decline of the Southern convict lease system, progressive era penal knowledge and reform, and the criminalization of alcohol and drugs during the 1920s Prohibition era. Finally,  the rise of the system of mass incarceration since the 1970s will be discussed.
